generatedTitle: The Role of George Washington in the American Revolution

extractFactDictList.question: Who was the nationalist leader associated with the American Revolution?
extractFactDictList.sentence: The nationalist leader associated with the American Revolution is George Washington.

extractFactDictList.question: When and where was George Washington born?
extractFactDictList.sentence: Born on February 22, 1732, in Westmoreland County, Virginia, Washington was the eldest son of Augustine Washington and his second wife, Mary Ball Washington.

extractFactDictList.question: What was George Washington's early political career?
extractFactDictList.sentence: Washington's early political career began in 1752 when he was elected to the Virginia House of Burgesses.
extractFactDictList.phrase: Elected to the Virginia House of Burgesses in 1752

extractFactDictList.question: What role did George Washington play in the American Revolution?
extractFactDictList.sentence: In 1775, he was appointed as the commander-in-chief of the Continental Army, leading the army to several key victories against the British.
extractFactDictList.phrase: Appointed as the commander-in-chief of the Continental Army
